website_summaries.verdict: A good budget paint-on bed liner if you're looking for a first-time product to buy that is easy to use quickly.
pros: Single gallon can is large enough for a couple of coats in an average size truck bed
The bed liner material, when wet, is easy to apply with a paintbrush or roller
Dries quickly for almost immediate use
cons: Bed liner finish will require some touching up or spot repairs sooner than more premium roll-on brands

customer_reviews.title: You can do a lot of things with this product.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to create a faux landau roof for my 97 Cougar. It worked perfectly. My car really has a classy look now. NOTE: This works MUCH better than the spray version of the same product. I did not use a foam roller - I used a paint brush for better control, first painting the product on a small area, then using the side of the brush to pat the surface lightly to remove brush marks. I saved a small amount for touch ups. See photos for the end result. It is important to STIR BEFORE LOADING THE BRUSH - EVERY TIME - TO MAKE SURE THAT THE SOLIDS SUSPENDED IN THE PRODUCT ARE EVENLY DISTRIBUTED.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Thornell

customer_reviews.title: followed the instructions and thought everything looked great. After the first usage (1 week later)
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my truck, followed the instructions and thought everything looked great. After the first usage (1 week later), already got marks in the paint. This was just moving some plywood around. Was hoping this would be a bit more robust, but sadly it didn't do well. Overall, it beats what I had on the truck before and worse comes to worse I'll reapply as needed on spots.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Easy Application.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to waterproof a tow behind trailer's domed cover instead of the problems associated with fiber glassing. It seems to have worked out VERY well after 4 weeks of towing at speed (45 to 70 mph ). No erosion noted, and we have had a lot of weather (rain ), used three coats after a period of cure ( 2 to 3 hours ) between each. I should add that the mileage is probably a little more than most people would put on. ( approx. 200 miles per week )
customer_reviews.author: Roger simmons

customer_reviews.title: looks and wears great. Just tape off
customer_reviews.text: I painted the hood of my Toyota pickup with this "Bedliner" paint almost 3 years ago, It needed a refresh and I wanted to do some on the fenders that had sun faded. The truck is a '94 Toyota pickup that has spent its whole life in So Cal and Texas and although it has no salt damage from road salt, the sun has taken it's toll on the paint. This stuff works, looks and wears great. Just tape off, roll on and let it dry. No rusting and no more sun damaged paint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... bed properly the coating is very durable and looks great. My black truck has stood up to Miami ...
customer_reviews.text: This roll in liner is a little labor intensive but if you prep the bed properly the coating is very durable and looks great. My black truck has stood up to Miami heat and several laborious jobs without a single chip in the finish. Rust-Oleum has turned out another solid product that will bring new life to any truck bed.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Gorog

customer_reviews.title: A little bit of heaven in each can.
customer_reviews.text: Man I love this stuff. I wish I had discovered it sooner. What can't it be used for? Anything black that needs painting now gets covered in Bed liner. We have so much humidity in South Florida, any bare metal rusts instantly. My 1994 Jeep Wrangler is slowly being transformed into a Bedliner beast. Patio furniture frames, towing accessories, wheelbarrow, my kids metal wagon, you name it. I started out with the rattle can but have worked my way up to the thicker stuff. Goes on smooth like butter without the need for as many coats as the rattle version. Although it is a little more difficult to get perfe
customer_reviews.author: David Green

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put on. I used it for the wheel wells, portions of the fenders, underneath the trunk, rocker panels, bottom of the doors, behind the top of the windshield, the door jams and several inches behind the grille on the hood for a car I had previously. Basically all the areas of a car that are prone to paint chips and we all know what happens after paint chips... RUST. I got sick of paint chips so I used the Rustoleum truck bed liner with a few different sizes of paint brushes. I was able to use 3 coats all with only ONE can. And it was on there thick. I wish I would've took pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Good for touch up
customer_reviews.text: Bought used truck with beat-up coating, so scrubbed it with brush and soap, hosed-off, dried. Used this can to roll a fresh coat on the bed after first using a brush to daub in the gouges. (Let that dry first) Worked fairly well, not quite as thick as the commercial $$$ application , but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied CustomerTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: great finish
customer_reviews.text: I used this on the inside of a John Deere garden wagon that I refinished and so far it is holding up without a scratch. I took extra time and installed multiple coats using 2 quarts for a 2'X4'X2' cart so it is on thicker that recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Papa D

customer_reviews.title: Get more than you need and apply liberally.
customer_reviews.text: Goes on thinner than I had hoped, but seems to hold up okay despite this. Definitely not comparable to professionally applied truck bed liner but certainly adds quite a bit of protection. Order at least twice as much as you think you'll need.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby H

customer_reviews.title: Decent protective liner
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product. Personally I used it to paint old metal weight plates. The coating is pretty durable and looks nice. It's tricky to get the material clean enough for the liner to stick. It was also aggravating to see that every step of the directions point to another rustoleum product that they want you to buy. Overall it works well but can be tricky to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Provides an extremely tough coating after curing.  Excellent product!  Wear a Resirator!
customer_reviews.text: My application for this product was to seal the underside surfaces ( plywood and steel framing) of my 5x8 foot enclosed trailer. One quart can was exactly what I needed. The truck bed coating has several safety warnings and I highly recommend working outside ( not in a garage) and wearing gloves and a quality respirator to protect your lungs from the volitile chemicals in this product. It is very difficult to remove and drips or splashes from garage floors and your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mr University of Florida

customer_reviews.title: Good for cheap cover up in bed.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and inexpensive. Used this to redo a old work truck to polish a turd. Old stuff work better but for price made bed looks alot better. For the cost added value to vehicle for looks but did not work as good as old stuff but old stuff was 12 years old and need to cover rust repairs in bed.
customer_reviews.author: jason lee powell

customer_reviews.title: Nice Liber, Easy To Apy
customer_reviews.text: I got this to effectively “paint” a roof cargo basket to help make sure it wouldn’t rust. It was easy to apply, seems durable, and looks pretty good. I’ve been thinking about doing the fender flares on my Jeep with bedliner, and after using this on the rack, I wouldn’t hesitate to use it on the flares. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Works well but it’s not the easiest
customer_reviews.text: I used this to resurface a false bottom for a grooming tub. It works well and is fabulous however it’s very watery and does not coat well without dumping it directly from the can to the surface. Maybe the tools they say to use with them help but I doubt it for what I used it for. Still holding up fine dog after dog after dog day after day after day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It looks good
customer_reviews.text: i read the reviews and did a little prep work. this worked well. i used a small roller. It looks good too. i didn't do prep on the rims and had an issue with sticking. can't fault the paint for that.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: GOES ON EASY / STINKS LIKE THE DEVILLLL....
customer_reviews.text: TOO EARLY TO KNOW HOW DURABLE THIS COATING IS... BUT IT GOES ON REALLY EASILY AND COVERS NICELY... THE VOLATILE COMPONENTS REALLY DONT SEEM TO BE TOO BAD WHILE APPLYING PRODUCT BUT FOR DAYS AFTER AS THE COATING CURES AND DEGASES AND IN ENCLOSED SPACE IT IT TERRIBLE BAD AND PENETRATING... WHEW....
customer_reviews.author: agelsss

customer_reviews.title: Flows from the paintbrush evenly with a good texture.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the spray on version several times over the years, it has always performed well. I used this to paint the brush guard on my Pro-4x, it too flowed on evenly without a hitch ( I used a paint brush instead on a roll on). Will use the remaining (which is a lot) to touch up the bed coating when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shindoru

customer_reviews.title: This really good paint
customer_reviews.text: The bed on my truck was starting to rust. I sanded it and used this paint and it worked great. It has been on now for 3 months and still looks great. The paint goes on smooth and covers well. It dries quickly, is holding up to the abuse, and looks good. I have also used it on the tractor with good results.
customer_reviews.author: Flower

customer_reviews.title: Take your time mixing it, then applies super easy with paint brush!
customer_reviews.text: I painted the interior floor boards of my 2001 TJ. Painted on first coat, waited 2 hours then painted on second. Let dry for 24 hours then placed back the rubber floor mats. I am very happy with the results. Just be sure to spend some time mixing and stirring, as the thicker stuff sits at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Mikester86

customer_reviews.title: Ridgeline Bed Looks New!
customer_reviews.text: Came in early. Found it easier to brush on and then use small roller for a uniform finish. If you follow directions, you can put on second coat in about 4 hours. Seems very durable after curing in about 48 hours--kept tarp over the bed to ensure no rain or dew to prevent water on the finish. One quart covered the whole bed, all sides and tailgate. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: OK!
customer_reviews.text: Project still in progress... patching a spray on truck bed! Used my first quart to level some rips and tears in original bed. Will be going back and repaint entire bed when I get everything sealed and level. Will use a textured roller to apply! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moore

customer_reviews.title: Horrible stuff...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible stuff! Has the consistency of runny black model paint with some sand thrown in. I did the recommended prep and shook the can several minutes. When I applied it I got runs and bubbles. After it dried, and after driving my truck, found pieces flaked off.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I refurbished a trailer bed with this product. It went on easily and has held up nicely. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Malone

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. I purchased 2, the first one was a very runny consistency, and once applied, peels right off. the second came opened in the package, mostly dry and unusable. There is not returns on these items, and I am $45 out on a really crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: ... will buy dura back it works and covers much better. The rust-oleum doesn't cover well and is very
customer_reviews.text: Next time I will buy dura back it works and covers much better. The rust-oleum doesn't cover well and is very thin
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good coating
customer_reviews.text: Great coating, but don't waste your money on the applicator kit - just includes a disposable brush, a useless roller and a disposable plastic pain pan.... But your own roller or brushes separately and save the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R.

customer_reviews.title: Better that spray on Rust-Oleum
customer_reviews.text: I used the spray on version of Rust-Oleums bed liner before this. The spray on looked great but didn't hold up to scratches. This however seems much stronger and applies with a similar texture.
customer_reviews.author: SiB

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Thick tough stuff, but u have to put on alot of coats cause if ya don't it'll just chip.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: This stuff sucks. Went over old stuff and it made spots bubble up. This stuff I guess is not meant for that. Wouod never buy again. So scraped it and bought spray on and works better.
customer_reviews.author: mike seals

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly easy to apply! Adhears well but some sanding may be required . It has a very strong odor so make sure your in a well ventilated area.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Beralek

customer_reviews.title: Used this for a subwoofer box... wouldn't recommend for that, but it's good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This product is plenty durable for my expectations and use. I wouldn't recommend it on wood because it will smell for a week, but it's good!
customer_reviews.author: Cole Green

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I gave this 4 out of 5 stars is that I wished the texture was a bit more pronounced. However, the product applies with ease, very few brush marks, and is durable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good but stinky
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cover the diamond plate bed on Mule side x side. Texture varied across the bed, but it seems to be doing its job. I used three coats. Definitely be in an open area when applying. Lost numerous brain cells from the fumes.
customer_reviews.author: jf

customer_reviews.title: This item worked well for me.
customer_reviews.text: Prompt shipping. Item as advertised. Worked great for a "recoat" for existing spray on bedliner.
customer_reviews.author: LeeB

customer_reviews.title: we were satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: It did the job o.k.but when we got the product, the can was so badly dented my husband was afraid to open it for fear it would spurt all over. It was packed very well so we're thinking it wasn't the carriers fault. Otherwise, we were satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Reed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great stuff , works well. bought a second can to finish full bed in my 2014 ram 1500
customer_reviews.author: Longview Ron

customer_reviews.title: This did not meet my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I opted to spray this in the back of my pickup with an undercoating gun. I was initially happy with the results but it dried too hard and chips right off if you put anything in the bed.
customer_reviews.author: GCAM

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn’t there
customer_reviews.text: Not a very good bedliner product. Doesn’t have much to offer as far as abrasive material and basically looks like I put a crappy paint job on my bed. It was cheap though. Guess you get your moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Abbigale Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Coated a silver toolbox
customer_reviews.text: I sanded and cleaned an alluminum toolbox and then coated it with this. Two coats did the trick, it has held up two seasons now with only one place the paint has come off where I hit the box. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Drew W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product used this to paint the inner fender wells ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product used this to paint the inner fender wells of my pick up truck. Hopefully this helps prevent rust for a few years
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - YOU WANT TO BUY THE "PROFESSIONAL GRADE" ONLY
customer_reviews.text: This is not what you want. You want to purchaser the "Professional Grade" bed liner kit because its actually a 2 part epoxy that is 10 times stronger than this stuff. Don't waste your money on this stuff. You're welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P Teasley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but not great
customer_reviews.text: It ain’t Linex but in this instance, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Crane

customer_reviews.title: Worked just as expected. I used this on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked just as expected. I used this on the inside cab floor on my '64 Dodge truck, which is about the same size as a standard cab Dakota, S10 or Ranger. The 32 ounce can was just enough to do the entire floor and up the foot well to the firewall. It dried to the touch in about an hour and solid the next day, with the outside air temp in the high 60's and low humidity. After 24 hours I painted over the bed coating and the color coat seems to adhere well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Bedliner for off-road bumpers, skids, sliders
customer_reviews.text: Use this stuff on sliders, skids, and aftermarket bumpers. Works pretty good. Nice thing is it’s easy to touch up.
customer_reviews.author: StlAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: This one is the best rust protect! After use I feel my can like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Kuma

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONY ,LOOK BAD
customer_reviews.text: I WISH I REMOVE IT FROM MY TRUCK .LOOKED VERY BAD AFTER I FINISHED .
customer_reviews.author: Maher Atalla

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it?
customer_reviews.text: For the price per quart, I thought it was going to be a textured product, basically just an oil base black paint? Don't really get why its sold as a truck bed product?
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Rolled this on my eBay running boards and it’s looks great
customer_reviews.author: sandy  xiong

customer_reviews.title: It works .
customer_reviews.text: Worked great easy to put on. Just roll it on with roller and your done. Don't forget to clean and sand first it sticks better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It looks really nice and seems fairly durable
customer_reviews.text: Used to coat a custom bumper I built. It looks really nice and seems fairly durable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging.
customer_reviews.text: The package was opened upon receipt and immediately a strong gaseous odor was present. Turns out the product has been seeping out onto the label and into the bubble wrap. Please revisit the packaging of the product. Not sure how the product, once it’s applied will perform...haven’t gotten that far.
customer_reviews.author: M Pallo

customer_reviews.title: TRASH
customer_reviews.text: This is trash, could be used on a trash can maybe? Because compared to other roll on bedliners I would 10/10 not recommend. Spend the extra dollars and get herculiner.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: works very well, I used it inside my car ...
customer_reviews.text: works very well, I used it inside my car for extra protection, if you don't want to use carpet for weight reduction.
customer_reviews.author: LetsrollQ

customer_reviews.title: One can covers only 25 sq feet
customer_reviews.text: Product says one can will cover 35-40 sq feet. That is not true. I gave a very thin application and it covered about 25 sq feet. I had to order a second can to finish my truck bed. Can is very small size.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Have used a lot before,
customer_reviews.text: Have used a lot before ,adheres well and dries to a tough finish
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Easy to Apply
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my Dodge D150 truck. Easy to apply and refreshes the look of my sprayed on Rhino Liner bed covering. I used a small brush to apply the product to get into all of the pattern lines of the bed covering for a complete professional-looking finish.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Kotis

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excelente product. It covered my 6.5ft bed but tailgate, so account for 2qts if you want good coverage
customer_reviews.author: Luis Portillo

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be shaken or stirred heavily!
customer_reviews.text: Get this can shaken before use or you will be stirring for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Walken

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I lined the lower section of my truck to protect against rust from mud and snow. Works great! Looks good and is so simple to apply. Coats in one pass. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 cans on my van floor and it works great
customer_reviews.author: 4x4 Sprinter Van Explorer

customer_reviews.title: Wet and messy don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product wet and messy to work with did an awful job! Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Rausch Family

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well. Make sure that the surface you are going to coat is clean and prepped properly and this product will lay down a very durable and protective coat. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: KentR

customer_reviews.title: seems to be holding up pretty well ( been on for about 3 months )
customer_reviews.text: Painted my roof rack with it, seems to be holding up pretty well ( been on for about 3 months )
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stir it up good so the grit mixes in before you apply. Goes on great. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to apply, rolled on real nice and dried real fast. Its not very textured so it just looks like rough black paint and not sure it will hold up to a whole lot of abuse. I put it in the inside of my Jeep, I wouldn't recommend this for the back of a pickup. Also I applied it over 4 weeks ago and on a hot day it gets tacky and comes off of things that you set on it.
customer_reviews.author: John Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today love it so far I’m going to try and scratch it a bit to see how much it can handle
customer_reviews.author: Crissy

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: My truck originally had a sprayed-in bed liner. After about 10 years, it started eroding. So, I used this Rust-Oleum product to sort of reseal it. It's only been a few weeks. But so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Easy too apply with roller brushes, prep is key though. Sand sand clean clean. Then paint. Brought my 94 ranger back to life.
customer_reviews.author: christopher shane byrom

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Durable paint but very smelly. Use in a well ventilated area with a respirator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Off-label use: coating metal steps to prevent rust and provide grip
customer_reviews.text: We actually used this to coat our back steps (which are metal). This helps keep it from rusting and also makes them less slippery in all kinds of weather. Great off-label use!
customer_reviews.author: K. Poby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product! You need two quarts to do a full size truck!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty happy. The container came open because the surrounding ...
customer_reviews.text: The product was a bit thin but worked well with three coats. Overall pretty happy. The container came open because the surrounding packing material was lacking. Contacted Amazon but received no response.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product and exactly what I was looking to use on my truck bed. I put two coats and it is holding up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Sayers

customer_reviews.title: pretty good stuff
customer_reviews.text: pretty good stuff. did not use it for a truck bed liner, but used it on a go kart frame. great product for that project.
customer_reviews.author: ijnhy65

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not thin or runny
customer_reviews.text: My slidein camper messed up by Bed liner and I had bare metal showing. I purchased this because of the high reviews and it does work great
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Handrick

customer_reviews.title: awesome. My whole 97 4 runner is painted in ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome. My whole 97 4 runner is painted in this.
customer_reviews.author: robert petrovsky

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Double coated used skid plate for gas tank. Try to do this outside. Fumes are intense.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had a bit more rough texture.
customer_reviews.text: Works and dries fast.Easy to apply with brush or roller
customer_reviews.author: Patti G.

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Awesomely hard stuff when cured. Easy to apply just have good ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Was exactly what I was needing for the floorboard of the cab of my old truck. This 32-oz size was just enough to do the floorboard.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Barta

customer_reviews.title: ... on the underside of a truck restoration and had great results. I primed first and rolled this stuff ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on the underside of a truck restoration and had great results. I primed first and rolled this stuff on with two light coats. It has a nice texture and holds up really well to scuffs. Wear gloves and a mask, this stuff is pretty nasty.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous24

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my brother's TJ works fine, but you have to use three coats. Must do heavy coats
customer_reviews.author: StupidRepellent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amount for average bed size (Dodge Dakota
customer_reviews.text: Perfect amount for average bed size (Dodge Dakota, Ford Ranger, etc.) however, would recommend purchasing larger can for mid size and heavy duty trucks.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Used the coating on the bed of my work truck. Looks great, durable, and dried quickly. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: George Reha

customer_reviews.title: I'd definitely recommend spraying it in
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cover scratches on my already rhinolined truck bed. I'd definitely recommend spraying it in. I used a roller and brush. It took forever and I barely had enough to finish the job. I have a 5 1/2 foot bed. Overall came out ok.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Jax, FL

customer_reviews.title: Not all good
customer_reviews.text: The first half of can did not coat the truck bed. Despite stirring to mix it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truck bed coating
customer_reviews.text: Just used it and looks good for now. Will update regarding durability
customer_reviews.author: Abid  Hussain

customer_reviews.title: It goes on easy and seems durable from what I can tell so ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to coat the inside of a garden cart I pull with my lawn tractor. It goes on easy and seems durable from what I can tell so far.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Pretty watery. Needs numerous coats no sooner than 2-3 hours after each other to allow to dry. Also found it cheaper at a local big box retailer when I needed to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Adam May

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product just make sure you let dry all way!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey but if you do the proper prep work you're gonna love this tough finish.
customer_reviews.author: Mammy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Coverage was great, easy to apply and 1 qt covered my 6.5' chevy bed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Fowler

customer_reviews.title: This stuff rolls on great! It is tough and it works great
customer_reviews.text: This stuff rolls on great! It is tough and it works great. You must must must use an appropriate stirring tool prior to using this! The best bet would be something attached to a drill. Do not try to use this without stirring this up really well. Use an appropriate roller and you'll be rewarded. I just used some cheap, disposable, foam rollers and it worked out just fine. There is some odor with this so I'd recommend a well ventilated area.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shook

customer_reviews.title: Good do-it-yourself coating option
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a Tundra recall that required them to remove my truck bed for undercoating. When I got it back the bed retaining bolts had been replaced with nice, new shiny uncoated bolts. I didn't want to get a bigger charge from Line X to cover 6 bolts so tried this instead. 2-3 coats gives excellent toughness. It is blacker/glossier than I expected but am sire that will fade with time. It isn't quite as textured as the original Line X job but does have some texture. For the price, it cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Donner

customer_reviews.title: Two coats
customer_reviews.text: Ok could be thicker, I tell everyone to apply two coats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough to do one coat
customer_reviews.text: okay price for the amount paid for wish I could buy a gallon to do multiple coats
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good stuff has to be shaken well before use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good stuff has to be shaken well before use.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Less than 5 stars means the customer was an idiot
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in spray can form which is amazing and from what i can tell already this will be just as good. I can say that anyone who claims this is "tinted clearcoat" or " not very black" is an idiot who did not mix the product, I used an undercoating gun to apply this and it worked beautifully, its still curing as I type this. The graphic down the side was done with the spray can stuff and the lower section is the can via an undercoating gun. both were sanded and primed with the self etching primer
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is a great product, just not good for what I had in mind
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
